Riot love damage but hates strategy

banner of command is not strategy. You are buffing up minion, and thats the end of story. Oh my you just caused lane to push. Oh my you put it on bot side so you can do baron. This isnt strategy. This is tryndamere for 2200 gold.

If you are saying banner isn't strategy, then getting bot tower, then roaming up through mid, taking tower, then top and getting that tower isn't a strategy either, it's going through the motions. Banner is the same way, you do it because it works, it is dumb and annoying, but is a strategy none the less

Strategy is sacrificing something in order to gain something. You dont sacrifice anything when you banner a minion. Item costs close to nothing. It gives you armor and mr, move speed when close to towers + mini tryndamere. This isnt strategy. This is abuse. And its counterplay is literally another banner of command. You should not be rewarded for doing nothing.

Strategy is not defined by sacrificing something in order to gain something, that is not true in the slightest, strategy employs using resources to create a circumstance that favors you to MINIMIZE LOSSES and MAXIMIZE gains or chances of success. 
But my point still stands about the bot tower up through top tower seige, you risk very little because the enemy is forced to respond or lose it faster, and usually by the time they respond it is gone. On the other hand using up an item slot and spending gold to push waves while you aren't there isn't a sacrifice or anything right... and by your logic, does {{champion:83}} ult and minions have to be removed now because it does the same damn thing, and it can give him gold for it pushing without him?
what does {{champion:74}} sacrifice with his Illuminati turret array?

I don't like banner any more than the next person, but saying {{item:3060}} has no strategy, a large portion of the game becomes "not a strategy". It is however easily abused, which i agree full heatedly with you on

> [{quoted}](name=Boulderox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bETlPB1i,comment-id=00030002000000000001,timestamp=2018-06-12T18:00:45.545+0000)
>
> Strategy is not defined by sacrificing something in order to gain something, that is not true in the slightest, strategy employs using resources to create a circumstance that favors you to MINIMIZE LOSSES and MAXIMIZE gains or chances of success. 
> But my point still stands about the bot tower up through top tower seige, you risk very little because the enemy is forced to respond or lose it faster, and usually by the time they respond it is gone. On the other hand using up an item slot and spending gold to push waves while you aren't there isn't a sacrifice or anything right... 

You arent sacrificing slot, you get item that is, if my math is correct, around 90% gold efficient and thats only raw stats. If you paid 2200 gold for one time use item, a banner of command, then you are sacrificing something. 

>and by your logic, does {{champion:83}} ult and minions have to be removed now because it does the same damn thing, and it can give him gold for it pushing without him?

His ult is much easier to kill, its his ulti, he doesnt have option, to buy more usefull ulti into teamfight. Sure I do hate Yoricks ult, and honestly wish all these aids mechanics that reward you for doing nothing (utilizing minions, utilizing turrets, utilizing anything that doesnt require more brain activity than toddler when he is sleeping), but giving his ultimate to any champion(especially tanks and supports) that already build cheap items, and also making it much stronger than his own ult, simply isnt fair. Banner of command is stupid item that should be simply removed. You arent adding any gameplay when you buy this item, you are only making pushing againist it annoying, you are abusing the fact that enemy support did not buy it. Every time I see any strats like ZZ portal sion mid I want to puke. This play style is rewarding you for no game knowledge other than, if i build this cheap item early in the game, my lane opponent will loose tower for no effort at all. All of this stupid items should be removed. You should be rewarded for playing the game, not buffing AI (shit one too) controlled NPCs. This isnt MMO, you arent summoner.

> what does {{champion:74}} sacrifice with his Illuminati turret array?

Mana, cooldowns, they are stationary, they are easy to kill. And ye I still want this shit nerfed. But its much weaker compared to banner. + He has to be close to them for them to function. If you had banner, that passivelly buffed minions around you, I would consider that a "mechanic" even though this sounds dumb as fuck too. 

> I don't like banner any more than the next person, but saying {{item:3060}} has no strategy, a large portion of the game becomes "not a strategy". It is however easily abused, which i agree full heatedly with you on

Strategy requires brain activity. Its not strategy. Rotating top after pushing bot is strategy because someone had to find out that its optimal path. This wasnt even happening before LCS 3 years ago I guess? Now its norm because you wouldnt believe, in order to get better at the game, you can watch the game online. Someone had to come up with idea of making enemy top miserable after rushing your own turret. Season 4, noone rushed tower because everyone wanted to safe farm. Then koreans came up with strat that had 70% success rate. Bam internet came and now its norm. Noone came up with idea that banner of command was a good item. In fact this item is was so dog shit, noone built it few seasons back. Then rito had to come and fuck things up. You read what it does, you buff minion, end of thought process. Yeah buffing enemy minion before baron, requires whole list of thing to consider. Where is enemy laner, when will the minion come to the enemy tower, who is their pushing champion, when are we going to do baron. But if you play tryndamere you do same thing, however you go to that tower yourself, not your buffed up minion for 2200 gold, and you have to push it yourself, watch your team so you can tp if they fuck it up, watch the map so you know when you are going to get fucked. Banner of command does neither of these things.

2200 gold for that?  you're crazy.  NO ONE would buy that nonsense because they'd get a minion that dies to anyone that focuses it in a few seconds

if it was like the old potions for $400-450, then maybe, but still rather ridiculous
2200 for tryndamere sounds good to me

So when you banner a lane and then leave... you miss xp for all the minions that die to your banner wave.

Also... you don't per-say HAVE to sacrifice in order for something to be strategy. Now if you want to argue that banner is/was too good and needed to be removed... that's different. That's something people can debate just like yasuo's scaling being too good or not or if orn should have cc immunity back now that he's not unkillable and dealing more damage than rumble q in the danger zone while building full tank.

Most strategies are abuse. Abuse my teammate's pushing power in lane to invade enemy jg. Abuse malphite's knockup to give yasuo an easy ult. Abuse my pushing power as cait to get first tower gold and hopefully avoid power deficit midgame compared to some other adc's. Abuse my early game power and jg ganks to get hella fed on renekton and end game by 20 to avoid my weaker mid and trash late game.
Oh no I miss some exp.....too bad I get AT LEAST half of a towers health AND MOST of the gold in all the waves and if the DO send someone to stop it I get baron for free.

Exactly.

Strategy is sending your Teleport-carrying champion down bot while you try to bait a Baron skirmish to at least get one objective, because risk-reward is calculated and the outcome is still dictated by multiple factors.

Building Banner is set and forget, the risk when it’s too good is next to zero for the reward it was providing.

i'm pretty sure they just made a coding error somewhere by the recent videos.  they changed it to 50% reduction of everything but true damage when it used to be 100% magic damage

i'm not sure what they did with the enhanced minion stats as well (oh, there's what broke it, 50% reduced physical makes towers actually hit like pea shooters)

I mean, really?

if they addressed that instead of removing it, the game would be fine

technically its the same as rift herald. you summon her and she afk pushes a lane.
only difference is she does it faster.
Exactly. Banner isn't strategy it's buying a blueberry to push a lane while you teamfight and earn back the little gold it took to buy it in the first place.
